definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well

sentences.english: Nowadays an actress with voluptuous beauty seems to be very popular.
sentences.chinese: 现今，妖艳的女演员似乎很吃香。

sentences.english: Nowadays an actress with voluptuous beauty seems to be more popular than the one with intelligent look.
sentences.chinese: 现今，妖艳的女演员似乎比智慧型的女演员吃香。

sentences.english: These companies are popular in a credit crunch.
sentences.chinese: 这些公司在信贷紧缩时期很吃香。

sentences.english: This is an era in which specialists thrive and generalists do not.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个专才吃香而通才无用的时代。

sentences.english: In Epcot's European countries, the dollar still retains some value.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲的Epcot，美圆仍旧很吃香的。

sentences.english: The minister was in high favour at Court at that time.
sentences.chinese: 那位大臣当时在宫廷里很吃香。

sentences.english: Blogging, nice to see, is becoming a sought-after expertise.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴地看到，博客逐渐成为很吃香的技术。

sentences.english: Being a woman and a recent arrival doesn't play well in a conservative party. The party needs to be more desperate.
sentences.chinese: 女性和新手在一个保守的党派中并不吃香。

definition: to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
in the middle of the road/to be in the way/to hold power/(fig.) to predominate/to be in vogue
